According to the US Department of Labor, in a 2016 American Psychological Association survey, 3 in 5 employees said they have experienced negative impacts of work-related stress. If you are feeling the same, visit the Center for Workplace Mental Health.

The Center for Workplace Mental Health is a great place to go if you are feeling stress or anxiety or are facing challenges like absenteeism, reduced productivity, or increased healthcare or disability costs.
Support the Center for Workplace Mental Health to help people struggling with mental health issues in the workplace like stress and anxiety. You can support them on their website.

The Center for Workplace Mental Health works with employers and businesses on health, health-focused coalitions, and other partners to solve challenges and highlight innovative approaches to improving workplace mental health and making it a higher organizational priority.

According to the CDC, poor mental health and stress can negatively affect you and can reduce job performance, engagement, and communication. If you are struggling at work, contact the Center for Workplace Mental Health,
The Center for Workplace Mental Health has worked with organizations like American Airlines, Houston Texans, Kent State, US Bank, and the State of Ohio, and they can help you too.
If you are struggling with mental health at your job, with symptoms of stress and anxiety, contact the Center for Workplace Mental Health. You can find their website online.

The Center for Workplace Mental Health has been helping the San Francisco Giants through their emotional ups and downs over the past ten years. If you are struggling from mental issues, contact https://t.co/tvg7aK3J5s.

If you are an employer, the Center for Workplace Mental Health has a depression calculator for employers that uses a wealth of the latest research to model how depression impacts a company or organization, based on a few demographics.

My mind would then be opened up to conceive ideas that had the potential of giving me the solutions and succour. Hopelessness is a direct result of ingratitude for what you have; and this leads to a sense of anxiety and depression.

#mentalhealth

Each time I express gratitude for the small wins, it would be as though a weight were taken off my shoulders; and I would feel somewhat relieved.

#mentalhealth

Many times, I just prostrate in my study and thank God for the things that are still working for me in spite of the challenges and the tremendous financial obligations I may be confronting at that time. Time and again, this has worked for me.¬†

#mentalhealth

In my experience, I have discovered that gratitude for the seemingly small wins goes a long way in stemming the tide of anxiety and depression.

Second, celebrate small wins. Most often than not, we are so fixated on what seems not to be working that we become blindsided to the things that we are still getting right in our finances.

#mentalhealth

I would like to suggest that you try as much as possible to limit the pressure you put on yourself due to other‚Äôs expectations of you. If you die today, they would quickly move on.

#mentalhealth

We all seem to be under immense pressure these days most especially due to financial obligations. But if care is not taken; it might lead to negative effects.

#mentalhealth

Before he knew it, he began to find it difficult to sleep; and high blood pressure set in. The last time we spoke, he was scheduled for a brain scan because the doctors fear that the thing might have affected part of his brain.

#mentalhealth

He said, ‚ÄúWhen people expect so much from you, especially financially, and you don‚Äôt seem to be meeting up; you come under tremendous pressure.‚Äù He further told me that no matter how much he tried; he simply couldn‚Äôt meet up.

I was really concerned, and had to interview him; in order to get to the root cause. He told me pointblank that he was under tremendous pressure from people‚Äôs expectations of him.

#mentalhealth

#mentalhealth

#mentalhealth

I was completely burnt out and needed several weeks to recuperate. Another thing I quickly learned is that when you perpetually live in a state of anxiety; you would be susceptible to psychosomatic illnesses.

#mentalhealth
